en_first_half: Her name is Sally Jackson and she’s the best person in the world, which just proves my theory that the best people have the rottenest luck. Her own parents died in a plane crash when she was five, and she was raised by an uncle who didn’t care much about her. She wanted to
en_second_half: be a novelist, so she spent high school working to save enough money for a college with a good creative-writing program. Then her uncle got cancer, and she had to quit school her senior year to take care of him. After he died, she was left with no money, no family, and no diploma.
en_Completion: be a nurse, but he insisted that she go to secretarial school, and then he got mad when she didn't get a job right away. She had to raise her kid all by
vi_first_half: Tên bà là Sally Jackson, người tốt bụng nhất trần đời và là minh chứng sống cho câu triết lý cửa miệng của tôi: Người hiền chẳng bao giờ gặp lành. Mẹ tôi lên năm tuổi cũng là lúc ông bà ngoại tôi tử nạn vì máy bay rơi. Sau đó, bà được ông cậu mang về nuôi nhưng người đó chẳng thèm quan tâm gì đến cô cháu gái. Vì muốn làm
vi_second_half: tiểu thuyết gia, nên suốt thời gian học trung học, mẹ tôi vừa học vừa đi làm quần quật cốt dành tiền lên đại học dự khóa viết văn. Thế rồi ông cậu bị ung thư khiến mẹ tôi đang học lớp mười hai phải bỏ ngang để ở nhà chăm sóc cậu. Ít lâu sau, ông cậu mất bỏ lại mẹ tôi tứ cố vô thân, không tiền bạc, không bằng cấp.
vi_Completion: cho cuộc sống dễ chịu hơn, mẹ tôi đã bỏ nhà ra đi khi mới mười lăm tuổi và từ đó sống lang thang trên đường phố cho đến khi gặp cha tôi. Tuy nhiên, người đàn ông này không hề quan tâm đến mẹ tôi và khiến cho cuộc sống của bà trở nên khó khăn hơn. Cuối cùng, mẹ tôi đã phải tự mình nuôi nấng tôi và em gái tôi, và bà đã làm việc chăm chỉ để cung cấp cho
es_first_half: Se llama Sally Jackson y es la persona más buena del mundo, lo que demuestra mi teoría de que los mejores son los que tienen peor suerte. Sus padres murieron en un accidente aéreo cuando tenía cinco años, y la crió un tío que no se ocupaba demasiado de ella. Quería ser
es_second_half: novelista, así que pasó todo el instituto trabajando y ahorrando dinero para ir a una universidad con buenos cursos de escritura creativa. Entonces su tío enfermó de cáncer, por lo que tuvo que dejar el instituto el último año para cuidarlo. Cuando murió, se quedó sin dinero, sin familia y sin bachillerato.
es_Completion: actriz, pero no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar arte dramático porque tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para mantenerse a sí misma. A pesar de todo, siempre ha sido una persona muy optimista y ha sabido encontrar la felicidad en las pequeñas cosas de la vida. Es una de las personas más generosas que conozco, siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás sin esperar nada a cambio. Su sonris

en_first_half: The rest of the day, I’d rotate through outdoor activities, looking for something I was good at. Chiron tried to teach me archery, but we found out
en_second_half: pretty quick I wasn’t any good with a bow and arrow. He didn’t complain, even when he had to desnag a stray arrow out of his tail.
en_Completion: that I was much better at dodging arrows than hitting targets. Fencing was another disaster. I'd get frustrated and swing wildly, which kept my opponents on their toes, but didn't exactly make me a formidable swordsman. I was so terrible at wrestling that I finally had to be banned from the mat to prevent me from accidentally killing someone. The only thing I seemed to be naturally good at was hand-to-hand combat, which made sense, I suppose, given my history

en_first_half: The problem was, I couldn’t find a blade that felt right in my hands. Either they were too heavy, or too light, or
en_second_half: too long. Luke tried his best to fix me up, but he agreed that none of the practice blades seemed to work for me.
en_Completion: too long, or too short, or too curved, or too straight. I tried every blade in the armory, but none of them felt like an extension of myself, like a part of my own body. I was beginning to think that I would never find the perfect sword, that I would be stuck with a mediocre blade forever.

Đột nhiên, một người đàn ông già với mái tóc bạc và đôi mắt sáng tinh anh bước vào căn phòng. Ông ta nhìn tôi với một nụ cười ấm áp và nói: "Tôi có thể giúp bạn tìm kiếm một cây kiếm vừa tay bạn."

en_Completion: By the time he called a break, I was soaked in sweat. Everybody swarmed the drinks cooler. I grabbed a cold drink and sat down on a nearby bench, feeling relieved to have a break from the intense workout. As I sipped my drink, I noticed a group of people gathered around the coach, listening intently to his instructions. I wondered what they were discussing, but I was too tired to get up and join them. Instead, I closed my eyes and

en_second_half: trying to get out. The ADHD part of me wondered, off-task, whether the rest of his clothes were made the same way. What horrible things would you have to do in your life to get woven into Hades’s underwear?
en_Completion: their mouths open in silent screams, their eyes glowing like embers from the fiery rivers of the underworld. en_second_half: out that my most powerful weapon of fear is missing. So I searched for you myself, and when it was clear you were coming to me to deliver your threat, I did not try to stop you.”

en_first_half: Poor little Percy Jackson wasn’t an international criminal after all. He’d caused a commotion on that Greyhound bus in New Jersey trying to get away from his captor (and afterward, witnesses would even swear they had seen the leather-clad man on the bus-“Why didn’t I remember him before?”). The crazy man had caused the explosion in the St. Louis Arch. After all, no kid could’ve done that. A concerned waitress in Denver had seen the man threatening his abductees
en_second_half: outside her diner, gotten a friend to take a photo, and notified the police. Finally, brave Percy Jackson (I was beginning to like this kid) had stolen a gun from his captor in Los Angeles and battled him shotgun-to-rifle on the beach. Police had arrived just in time. But in the spectacular explosion, five police cars had been destroyed and the captor had fled. No fatalities had occurred. Percy Jackson and his two friends were safely in police custody.

en_second_half: dummies’ heads right off, stabbing through their straw-stuffed guts. His orange counselor’s shirt was dripping with sweat. His expression was so intense, his life might’ve really been in danger. I watched, fascinated, as he disemboweled the whole row of dummies, hacking off limbs and basically reducing them to a pile of straw and armor.
